message_1: Suppose you want to schedule 10 teams to play in a round-robin tournament where each team plays against each other exactly once. How many games need to be played?
message_2:
To determine the number of games that need to be played in a round-robin tournament with 10 teams, we can use the formula for combinations:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

In this case, n = 10 (the number of teams) and k = 2 (since each game consists of 2 teams playing against each other).

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!(10-2)!)

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 × 9 × 8!)/(2 × 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 × 9)/2

C(10, 2) = 90/2

C(10, 2) = 45

So, 45 games need to be played in a round-robin tournament with 10 teams.
